intro: Tarenna flavofusca, commonly known as the yellow-flowered tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth surface. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
